intro: Craspedia fimbriata var. robusta, commonly known as the robust craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is often used in coastal gardens for its hardiness and ornamental value.
